intro: Laserpitium commune, commonly known as common hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Laserpitium commune typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer.
